content: Analyze the grammatical error in this sentence, which contains a double adverb: "Despite his infrequent television viewing habits, he hardly ever ever watches TV."

The sentence contains a grammatical error due to the repetition of the adverb "ever." The phrase "hardly ever" is already a complete adverbial phrase, meaning "almost never" or "rarely." By repeating "ever," the sentence becomes redundant and incorrect. The corrected sentence should read: "Despite his infrequent television viewing habits, he hardly ever watches TV."
